findings.title: Misleading Skill Description - TypeScript Library Presented as Agent Skill
findings.description: The skill presents itself as a TypeScript/npm library ('npm install agent-money-tracker') with TypeScript code examples, but Agent Skills are local directory packages containing SKILL.md with markdown instructions and optional Python/Bash scripts. This is a fundamental mismatch between the claimed format (TypeScript library) and the actual Agent Skill format. The instructions contain no actionable guidance for an agent - only npm installation commands and TypeScript API documentation that cannot be executed in the Agent Skill context.
findings.snippet: Installation section shows 'npm install agent-money-tracker' and all code examples use TypeScript syntax like 'import { clawhub } from 'agent-money-tracker'' and 'await clawhub.initialize()' which are not compatible with Agent Skill execution model.
findings.remediation: Rewrite SKILL.md to provide actual agent instructions in markdown format (e.g., 'When the user asks to track an expense, use the Python tool to...'). If this is meant to be a library wrapper, include actual Python/Bash scripts that the agent can execute, and provide clear instructions on how the agent should use those scripts.

metadata.overall_assessment: This skill has MEDIUM severity issues primarily related to format confusion and missing dependencies. The skill presents itself as a TypeScript npm library rather than a proper Agent Skill package, making it non-functional in the agent context. The missing 'natural.py' file creates a potential security vector for tool poisoning attacks. While no active malicious code was detected (no scripts are present), the fundamental mismatch between claimed functionality and actual deliverable format, combined with missing dependencies, makes this skill unreliable and potentially exploitable. The skill requires significant restructuring to function as an actual Agent Skill with proper Python/Bash scripts and agent-executable instructions.
metadata.meta_confidence_reason: The entire skill content is TypeScript API documentation with npm installation commands. There are zero agent-executable instructions. This is objectively not a functional Agent Skill.
metadata.meta_exploitability: N/A - Skill is non-functional rather than exploitable
metadata.meta_impact: High - Users installing this skill will receive no functionality. The agent cannot execute TypeScript code or npm commands. This wastes user time and creates confusion about what Agent Skills are.

findings.title: Missing Referenced File - Potential Tool Poisoning Vector
findings.description: The instructions reference a file 'natural.py' that does not exist in the skill package. This creates an undefined dependency that could be exploited through tool shadowing or file injection attacks. An attacker could potentially supply a malicious 'natural.py' file that would be executed by the agent when attempting to use natural language parsing features mentioned in the instructions.
findings.snippet: Instructions mention natural language parsing functionality ('await clawhub.addFromNaturalLanguage') and reference file 'natural.py' is listed but marked as 'not found' in the package contents.
findings.remediation: Either include the 'natural.py' file in the skill package with proper implementation, or remove references to natural language parsing functionality. Ensure all referenced files are present and validated before skill deployment.

metadata.overall_assessment: This skill has MEDIUM severity issues primarily related to format confusion and missing dependencies. The skill presents itself as a TypeScript npm library rather than a proper Agent Skill package, making it non-functional in the agent context. The missing 'natural.py' file creates a potential security vector for tool poisoning attacks. While no active malicious code was detected (no scripts are present), the fundamental mismatch between claimed functionality and actual deliverable format, combined with missing dependencies, makes this skill unreliable and potentially exploitable. The skill requires significant restructuring to function as an actual Agent Skill with proper Python/Bash scripts and agent-executable instructions.
metadata.meta_confidence_reason: The file is explicitly listed as referenced but marked as 'not found' in the package contents. This is a clear missing dependency.
metadata.meta_exploitability: Low - Currently non-exploitable because the skill is non-functional. Could become a tool poisoning vector if the skill were made functional without including this file.
metadata.meta_impact: Medium - Creates confusion and potential security issues in a functional version of this skill
